channel.title: Comments for page "Glowslinging Strategy Guide"
channel.description: Posts in the discussion thread "Glowslinging Strategy Guide"

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: @palumatzu Yes, as far as I know, gambits are merely extra EX (though I don't think there's anything more than 3-chain other than the deadly rave, mostly useful for the final boss).

item.title: Trivia: Hunter's Chain
item.content:encoded: Possible reference to the Hunter Chain combo system introduced in Capcom's Darkstalkers fighting game.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: do all gambits merely award extra EX? I noticed there's 3-chain and 5-chain gambits, but i'm having a hard time getting any beyond 3-chain

item.title: Nailbiter
item.content:encoded: The nailbiter bonus does NOT break autosmash streaks, being at or below 0 hp at the end of a match (bonuses be damned) breaks autosmash streaks.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Traintop, fighting a Train Robber, and he has a skill called Fierce. +1 level on Beat. No one has mentioned this anywhere here at all. Any reason why? Is it just that useless? If so, there should be a definitive list of "abilities to avoid and why" so abilities like this, if tht is the case, are avoided at all costs. A recommended ability capture skillset for level ranges would also be useful to a degree, so you know what ability to sacrifice for damage and what ability to keep, et al.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Fair enough. Not aiming to cover that kind of reference at all, just to give about a paragraph or two per turf on 'Hey, what you should know for getting started here and what you should know for fighting the boss', because I don't think that's anywhere cleanly.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Now, I completely agree with you that the guide could use some improvement. Guidelines on levels needed for turfs/bosses and so on, but please don't try to make it into a reference work. We already have that under village/billycon/glowslinging, (but adding a link is probably a good idea).

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: I'm still real early in Glowslinging, but I think I'll start updating this with progress as I go, because while I'm glad this exists, the guide pretty much tells you nothing worthwhile for what will likely be your first few weeks of glowslinging, and even as it goes across, it lacks the very useful information of just how strong enemies are and what kind of things they'll be bringing against you. Without that, it's just trial and error to figure out whether you're ready to move on, and that's kind of sad if someone is reading a guide on it. I'll definitely miss some detail, but I figure at least getting some chunks of these on there would be a solid improvement from where it is.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Nobody said the Portal was easy. Going from Clock Tower to Portal of Awesome is akin to going from Playground to Dramatic Cliff. It's a huge spike in difficulty.

Fighting in the Portal is from a HUGE disadvantage. The enemies have a passive +19 to all their Rolls, and ignore Risk completely. You may only stay a couple points of Spin higher than the opponent, but that still helps swing things in your favor.

And it's better to spam FA and remain a point or two higher, than to not use it, and be a point or three lower because they'll use Dark Whirlwind anyway.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Is it my imagination, or is the advice for Portal turf nonsense? It doesn't matter how much you spam FA and how often you WR to remove risk, thanks to Dark Whirlwind you are only ever a couple of points of Spin ahead.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: i think everything needed is in there. i don't see how it could be better as all you need to know are the stats you'll be fighting against. some give suggestions on skills and stuff also.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Can we please get someone to write a better guide for the bosses especially? Sitting ehre looking at the 9/9/9/9/9 of QuietMiku and wondering how the hell I'm supposed to beat that coming off of the Parking Lot. -.-;

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
UFT only uses are when you're fighting The Eleven and FutureMiku.

For starting out on the Portal, I advise Weighted Weapons + Hunter Chain + Hit Confirm, until you have UFT, then swap Hit Confirm for something like Followthrough until you reach 11 wins.

Personally, as soon as I got UFT, I went right back to the Clock Tower for grinding, and only fought in the Portal itself enough times to get the 11 wins.

Against The Eleven, you'll want WW + HCh + UFT.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Wait a sec, change d-punch for UFT, right?

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Also, I actually advise the removal of Dragon Punch once the Portal of Awesome is reached, as you'll want to keep opponents there below 200 EX, or they'll just keep killing all your Spin with Wave of Discord.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Ok, bro, I changed the page according to this :) Also found at BvS forum some posts from player that forgot equipping and put it in this too :)

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Once you can get Weighted Weapons from Traintop, though, it should immediately be equipped.

And once WW is equipped, there's no need to be scared of Dark Whirlwind anymore, as your Spin will still rise faster than your opponents.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
"Turfs 7-8 Strategy (Dramatic Cliff and Traintop)

Charge, Hunter's Chain, Weight Weapons(c-c-c-combo breaker or roundhouse)"

"Weighted Weapons Frame Advantage gets +1 Spin"

If we scare Dark Whirlwind and shouldn't have spin higher than opponent, we shouldn't advice Weighted Weapons as part of set, counting that it can be stealed/leaned at Traintop only and so can not help at turf 7-8 as players weaker to use skill slot for Hit Confirm or sth. I'll fix it in few minutes.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: After I got Hunter Chain and used it for a while, do not really need Flashy Thing anymore :)

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
I mostly talking about battles when u trying controll both spins and enemy's risk, more less often it is hard for me to control my risk. In average for me difficulty battles I rather successfull use combination of: Practiced and Flashy Thing, other 2 slots for "farming" like Hit Confirm, Discerning Eye, Royal Wave, etc. 2nd reason for me can be love to use AC when opponent is dow to 1/3 hp and I reseted skill uses to be "new as a baby" and do not look at -1 or 2 ranges and finish harder. Flashy Things is cheap skill to learn that helps me prepare more different variants of moves depending on opponent's behavior, roll luck and so. FA and then spam TP is perfect advice, but only one algorithm do not garantee 100% wins, I think better describe for Flashy Thing for me is less power but big reserves to stay versus most powerfull computer's conter-attacks… OPPONENT CANNOT WASH! His uses are with him and even 1-2 risk in late game can break all his plans, luck with rolls, MikuMikuPhi, etc. I can wash and make clean wins :)

P.S. Of course at higher fields I'll use something else and try all advices in battle practice, but right now it is what I've met and muli-checked :)

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
I'm hard pressed to think of any situation where use of Flashy Thing is actually reccomended.. Maybe if you had super high risk, or wanted to stop the opponent from GC spamming your FA spam…

And at 3 EX, the cost is too high for such marginal usefulness. Better to use it on, say, Judgement Javelin, at a low level, and at higher levels, it's 3 'castings' of Mystic Eyes

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: And what about Flashy Thing? Maybe it would be good to add this at "Tech to get"? I do not imagine ma fights without it:) What about others? Does anyone else use Flashy Thing?

item.title: Promote to the Top menu?
item.content:encoded: Can someone (possibly North) please place this in the top menu for people? Currently it is kind of hidden.
